info.title: Apimatic API
info.description: This API gives you programmatic access to APIMatic's Code Generation, Docs Generation and Transformers Engine.

get.description: Query API Specification used as input for a specific generation using CodeGenId.
Query logs for all code generations performed by a user.

post.description:
Execute Code Generation by specifying path address of an API specification file. 

This endpoint does not import an API or store specification files.

inputtedFile.description: API Spec in any of the supported formats

get.description: Query details for a specific generation by specifying CodeGen Id

delete.description: Delete an entire generation by specifying generation Id.

get.description: Download a generated SDK by specifying CodeGen Id as input.
Download a transformed specification by specifying Transformation Id.

post.description: Perform a transformation by specifying file address from local storage

inputtedFile.description: The file must be in a supported format

get.description: Returns logs for all transformations performed by the user.
Pull logs for a certain transformation by specifying Transformation Id.

parameters.name: transformationId
parameters.description: Unique Id generated against each Transformation

delete.description: Deletes records for a specific  transformation using Transformation Id.

get.description: Returns the input file of a specific Transformation using Transformation Id.

Returns detailed logs on an API Entity using an API Entity ID including: Endpoints, Endpoint Groups , Custom Types, CodeGen Settings, TestGen Settings, Additional Headers, Authentication Details, Server Configuration and External Documentation.

put.description: Import an API Version by specifying file path address of an API Spec to replace an existing version.

file.description: API Spec file to be inmported

post.description: Import an API by specifying URL address of an API Spec

url.description: Web address of the API Spec

post.description: Import an API by specifying  path address of an API Spec file

file.description: API Spec file in supported format

get.description: Returns the API Specification for a particular API Version.

post.summary: Import new API Version Via URL
post.description: Import a new API Version by specifying URL address of an API Spec.

put.summary: API Group -  Update Guide Section Settings
put.description: Update Guides section settings for an entire API Group.

parameters.name: apiGroupId
parameters.description: Group ID for the API to be updated

requestBody.description: Encapsulates all details of a new Guide. Details include ID, Section Name, Section Id, Heading and Body.

get.description: Query Guides Section settings for an API Group.

parameters.name: apiGroupId
parameters.description: Group ID for the API to be updated

put.description: Update Hosted Documentation for an API Entity

parameters.name: apiEntityId
parameters.description: Entity ID for the API to be updated

get.description: Generate Docs in JSON format against an API using API Key.

Generate a complete API Documentation Portal as a zip file, containing all the static assets required to host it entirely on premises.

Note: The response might take up to 4-5 minutes.

delete.description: Delete a specific generation against an API using API Entity Id and CodeGen Id.

get.description: Query logs for a specific generation against an API using API Entity ID and CodeGen ID.
Query details for all generations made against an API using the API Entity Id.

post.description: Generate SDK against a specific API using the API Entity Identifier and specifying the platform template.

get.description: Download SDK generated against a specific API using API Entity Id and the CodeGen Id.

put.description:
Update  Package Deployment Information for an API Entity. To find out more on how to publish a package visit: To find out more about adding packages to portal visit: [Adding Packages to Portal](https://docs.apimatic.io/developer-experience-portal/adding%20packages%20to%20portal/)

To find out more about publishing packages visit: [Publish Packages](https://docs.apimatic.io/developer-experience-portal/adding%20packages%20to%20portal/)

requestBody.description: Package Deployment Information to be updated. This comprises of the Platform Template, the Repository Name and Version.

get.description:
Query Package deployment details added for an API Entity.
To find out more about adding packages to portal: [Adding Packages to Portal](https://docs.apimatic.io/developer-experience-portal/adding%20packages%20to%20portal/)

UserCodeGeneration.title: UserCodeGeneration

inputFile.description: API Specification file in a supported format

UserCodeGeneration.description: The Code Generation structure encapsulates all the  the details of an SDK generation performed by a user.

APIEntityCodeGeneration.title: APIEntityCodeGeneration
APIEntityCodeGeneration.description: The Code Generation structure encapsulates all the  the details of an SDK generation performed against an API Entity

Response.title: Response

optional.description: Specify if response is optional or not

isMap.description: Specify if response is collected as map

Response.description: The structure encapsulates all details of a request response

ImplementationType.title: ImplementationType
ImplementationType.description: The structure helps describes the nature of implementation of a  custom model. A model can be of 3 types.

TestGenSettings.title: TestGenSettings

precisionDelta.description: Error margin for comparing values in decimal places

testTimeout.description: Number of seconds after which if the endpoint is not returning any response, the test is forced to fail e.g. a timeout of 60

configuration.description: The parameters allows to provide values for configuration file for use in the test environment

TestGenSettings.description: This structure helps specify additional test configurations which affects how test cases are generated.

Attributes.title: Attributes
Attributes.description: The structure contain attribute details of a parameter type.

Endpoint.title: Endpoint

skipAuthentication.description: If Endpoint warrants authentication or not

hasOptionalQueryParams.description: Enabling this option allows optional query parameters

hasOptionalFieldParams.description: Enabling this option allows optional field parameters

collectParameters.description: Enabling this option collects API endpoint parameters as collections

wrapBodyInObject.description: Enabling this option allows wrapping of body in objects

requiredScopes.description: What scopes apply to an Endpoint

Endpoint.description: This structure encapsulates all the attributes of an API Endpoint.

CustomType.title: CustomType
CustomType.description: This structure helps creates a new complex model type.

GuideSection.title: GuideSection
GuideSection.description: This structure encapsulates all the details of a Guide Section

Transformation.title: Transformation

inputtedFile.description: API Specification file to be transformed

generatedFile.description: API Specification file transformed to desired format

Transformation.description: Transformation structure encapsulates all the details of a Transformation.

CSNETSTANDARDLIB.title: CSNETSTANDARDLIB

additionalDeploymentInformation.description: Any additional platform specific deployment detail

CSNETSTANDARDLIB.description: This structure contains all details that goes into package deployment.

Authentication.title: Authentication
Authentication.description: This Structure encapsulates all details of API authentication.

TestCase.title: TestCase

endpointId.description: The Endpoint, test case is associated with

apiId.description: The API Entity, test case is associated with

expectedStatus.description: Expected response status. We expect the status code to be 200 if the operation is successful, hence we input the value 200.

expectedHeadersAllowExtra.description: If this flag is disabled, it will cause the test case to fail if the response contains other headers than those listed in the expected headers list.

expectedBody.description: Expected response goes in the expected body

expectedArrayOrderedMatching.description: If enabled, this will involve ensuring that the response body contains the array elements in the same order as the expected body.

expectedArrayCheckCount.description: If enabled, this will ensure that the response body contains the same number of elements in the array as does the expected body.

TestCase.description: APIMatic lets you define test cases for endpoints using the API Editor. The test cases are automatically generated for each language. This structure encapsulates all details of a Test Case.  To find out more about defining Test Cases visit: https://docs.apimatic.io/testing/defining-your-first-test-case/

Environment.title: Environment

servers.description: The user can specify multiple servers within an environment. A server comprises of a name and a url.

Environment.description: An environment consists of a set of servers with base URL values. The environment can be changed programatically allowing rapid switching between different environments. For example the user can specify a Production and Testing Environment and switch between them in the generated SDK.

UpdateTemplatesPackageDeploymentInformat.title: UpdateTemplatesPackageDeploymentInformation
UpdateTemplatesPackageDeploymentInformat.description: This structure helps update package deployment details.

CodeGenSettings.title: CodeGenSettings

isAsync.description: Generate asynchronous code for API Calls and deserialization

useHttpMethodPrefix.description: Use HTTP Method prefixes for endpoint wrappers

useModelPrefix.description: Use "Model" postfixes for generated class names

useCommonSdkLibrary.description: Use common SDK library to reduce code duplication

generateInterfaces.description: Generates interfaces for controller classes in the generated SDKs

androidUseAppManifest.description: Use "AndroidManifest.xml" for config variables in Android

iosUseAppInfoPlist.description: Use "App-Info.plist" file for config variables in iOS

iosGenerateCoreData.description: Generate "CoreData" schema and entity classes in iOS?

preserveParameterOrder.description: Attempts to preserve parameter order for endpoints

appendContentHeaders.description: Append JSON/XML accept and content-type headers

nullify404.description: Return a null value on HTTP 404

validateRequiredParameters.description: Validate required parameters to be Not Null

enableAdditionalModelProperties.description: Allow models to have additional runtime properties

useControllerPrefix.description: Use "Controller" postfixes for generated controller classes

parameterArrayFormat.description: Parameter Array format with index or without

objCHttpClient.description: Configure the HTTP client for Objective C

cSharpHttpClient.description: Configure the HTTP client for C#

androidHttpClient.description: Configure the HTTP client for  Android

nodeHttpClient.description: Configure the HTTP client for node

phpHttpClient.description: Configure the HTTP client for PHP

timeout.description: This option specifies the duration (in seconds) after which requests would timeout

enableLogging.description: Enabling this generates code in the SDKs for logging events in the API cycle using a library.

enableHttpCache.description: Enabling caching of responses (not available in all languages)

retryInterval.description: Specify retry interval in case of failures

storeTimezoneInformation.description: Store Timezone information for the generation

enablePhpComposerVersionString.description: Use "Controller" postfixes for generated controller classes

underscoreNumbers.description: Use underscores before and after numbers for underscore case

useSingletonPattern.description: Allow usage of a Singleton Pattern

disableLinting.description: Files/dependencies used for linting are not generated if this option is enabled

allowSkippingSSLCertVerification.description: Create a configuration option in SDKs to optionally skip certificate verification when establishing HTTPS connections.

doNotSplitWords.description: Enabling this will stop splitting of words when converting identifiers from API specification to language-specific identifiers.

sortResources.description: Sorts resources such as endpoints, endpoint groups and models in generated documentation

CodeGenSettings.description: APIMatic’s code generation engine has various code generation configurations to customise the behaviour and outlook across the generated SDKS. This structure encapsulates all settings for CodeGeneration.

ExportFormats.title: ExportFormats
ExportFormats.description: The structure contains API specification formats that Transformer can convert to.

APIEntityDetailed.title: APIEntityDetailed
APIEntityDetailed.description: The structure collects API Endpoints and Custom Types to display detailed information on API Entity.

TemplatesPackageDeploymentInformation.title: TemplatesPackageDeploymentInformation
TemplatesPackageDeploymentInformation.description: This structure encapsulates all package deployment details.

InputParameter.title: InputParameter

endpointInputPrameterId.description: Unique parameter identifier for each endpoint

InputParameter.description: This structure helps specify details of an input parameter.

ServerConfiguration.title: ServerConfiguration
ServerConfiguration.description: Server configurations can be used to create multiple environments, multiple servers that can be used with specific endpoints and server URLs with template paramters.

UpdatePackageDeploymentInformation.title: UpdatePackageDeploymentInformation
UpdatePackageDeploymentInformation.description: This structure is used to update package deployment details.

CodeGeneration.title: CodeGeneration

hashCode.description: The md5 hash of the API Description

CodeGeneration.description: The Code Generation structure encapsulates all the  the details of an SDK generation performed against an API Entity

APIEntity.title: APIEntity

apiKey.description: API Integration Key. Obtain from API Card on Dashboard.

APIEntity.description: The API Entity Structure encapsulates all the details of an API Entity. An API entity is a unique API Version.

Field.title: Field

isArray.description: If Param is collected as array

Field.description: This structure encapsulates all details of a parameter.

UrlTransformationInput.title: UrlTransformationInput
UrlTransformationInput.description: This structure puts together the URL of the file to be transformed, along with the desired export format.

Server.title: Server
Server.description: The user can specify multiple servers within an environment. A server comprises of a name and a URL. The names of the hosts remain consistent over different environments but their values may vary. The URL values can contain any number of parameters defined.

Platforms.title: Platforms
Platforms.description: The structure contains platforms that APIMatic CodeGen can generate SDKs and Docs in.

PackageDeploymentInformation.title: PackageDeploymentInformation
PackageDeploymentInformation.description: The structure contains Package Deployment Information along with Id.

ImportNewVersion.title: ImportNewVersion
ImportNewVersion.description: This structure contains details of importing a new API Version

SectionItem.title: SectionItem
SectionItem.description: This structure encapsulates content that goes into a Guides Section.

Parameter.title: Parameter
Parameter.description: Parameters are options passed with the endpoint
